intro: Prunus eximia, commonly known as the California wild cherry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the western United States. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and oval-shaped leaves that turn yellow in the fall. The plant produces clusters of white to pink flowers in the spring, which are followed by edible, sweet cherries. Prunus eximia thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant in USDA hardiness zones 6 through 9. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in local ecosystems.
